summary: Add OTEL module to Bedrock manager in mlkit
description: Title: Add OTEL module to Bedrock manager in mlkit Value Statement: As an MLOps Engineer who invokes Bedrock agents and foundation models via BedrockManager, I need the ability to capture structured OpenTelemetry traces for agent invocations, model calls, and knowledge base operations so that I can gain deeper observability into agent behavior, debug performance issues, and integrate with existing OTEL-compatible observability platforms. AC: -1. Telemetry Configuration Module When a user instantiates BedrockManager, the user has the ability to optionally enable OpenTelemetry tracing via configuration or environment variables. -Support the following environment variables (matching OTEL standard): OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT - OTLP collector endpoint (optional) OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_HEADERS - Headers for OTLP requests OTEL_SERVICE_NAME - Service name (default: bip-ai-kit) OTEL_SEMCONV_STABILITY_OPT_IN - Semantic convention opt-in values When no OTLP collector is available, the user can enable ConsoleSpanExporter for local trace debugging -2. Agent Invocation Tracing When a user calls invoke_agent(), the user has the ability to see detailed span traces for the entire agent invocation lifecycle. Create parent span invoke_agent \{agent_id} with attributes: gen_ai. operation. name: invoke_agent gen_ai.agent. name: agent_id gen_ai.agent.alias_id: agent_alias_id gen_ai.session.id: session_id gen_ai.user.id: user_id (if provided) gen_ai.correlation. id: correlation_id (if provided) Create child spans for each trace event type parsed from _parse_trace_event(): orchestrationTrace. modelInvocationInput orchestrationTrace.modelInvocationOutput orchestrationTrace.rationale orchestrationTrace.observation orchestrationTrace.knowledgeBaseLookupOutput orchestrationTrace.actionGroupInvocationInput orchestrationTrace.actionGroupInvocationOutput preProcessingTrace postProcessingTrace failureTrace Record gen_ai.event. start_time and gen_ai.event.end_time on each span Record total_time_ms as span attribute on completion On error, set span status to ERROR and record exception 3. Foundation Model Invocation Tracing When a user calls invoke_foundation_model(), the user has the ability to see span traces for model invocations with token usage. Create span chat with attributes: gen_ai.operation.name: chat gen_ai.request.model: f_model_arn gen_ai.inference.profile: i_model_arn gen_ai.request.enable_cache: enable_cache Record input messages as span events using gen_ai.user.message or gen_ai.client.inference.operation.details On completion, record token usage attributes: gen_ai.usage.input_tokens gen_ai.usage.output_tokens gen_ai.usage.total_tokens gen_ai.usage.cache_read_input_tokens (if applicable) gen_ai.usage.cache_write_input_tokens (if applicable) Record response content as span event gen_ai.choice 4. Knowledge Base Operation Tracing When a user calls knowledge base methods, the user has the ability to trace retrieval and generation operations. Create span for retrieve_knowledge_base_chunks(): Span name: retrieve_kb \{kb_id} Attributes: gen_ai.kb.id, gen_ai.kb.query, gen_ai.kb.num_results Record retrieval_results_count on completion Create span for get_knowledge_base_response(): Span name: retrieve_and_generate \{kb_id} Attributes: gen_ai.kb.id, gen_ai.kb.model_arn 5. Metrics Instrumentation When a user enables metrics, the user has the ability to collect quantitative telemetry data. Create singleton BedrockMetricsClient with the following instruments: Counters: bedrock. agent.invoke_count bedrock.model.invoke_count bedrock.kb.retrieve_count bedrock.agent.error_count Histograms: bedrock.agent.duration (ms) bedrock.model.duration (ms) bedrock.model.input_tokens bedrock.model.output_tokens bedrock.kb.retrieve_duration (ms) Metrics can be exported to console or OTLP (when collector available) 6. BedrockManager Integration When a user uses BedrockManager, the user has the ability to transparently get tracing without code changes. Add optional telemetry parameter to BedrockManager.__init__(): Python def __init__(self, aws_account=None, tenant=None, telemetry: BedrockTelemetry = None): Add _tracer property that lazily initializes tracer Existing invoke_agent() method instruments traces when telemetry is enabled Existing invoke_foundation_model() method instruments traces when telemetry is enabled Backward compatible - no breaking changes to existing API 9. Documentation When a user reads the documentation, the user has the ability to understand how to enable and configure telemetry. Add docstrings to all new telemetry classes and methods Create docs/telemetry. md with: Overview of telemetry capabilities Configuration options and environment variables Example usage patterns Console exporter usage (for no-collector scenarios) OTLP collector setup guide (for future use) Update README.md with telemetry section 10. Testing When a user runs tests, the user has the ability to verify telemetry functionality. Unit tests for BedrockTracer span lifecycle methods Unit tests for BedrockTelemetry configuration Integration test demonstrating console export (no collector required) Mock tests for BedrockManager methods with telemetry enabled Assumptions The business will confirm the preferred OTEL_SERVICE_NAME default value prior to implementation OpenTelemetry Python SDK packages (opentelemetry-api, opentelemetry-sdk, opentelemetry-exporter-otlp-proto-http) will be added to project dependencies Dependencies None - this story can proceed independently since console exporter works without a collector Notes The Strands Agents SDK (strands-agents/sdk-python) telemetry module was used as a reference implementation Console exporter enables local debugging and development without requiring OTLP collector infrastructure When OTLP collector becomes available, users simply set OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT environment variable The existing log_traces parameter in invoke_agent() can be extended to also control OTEL span creation

summary: Add OTEL module to strands wrapper in mlkit
description:
Title: Add OTEL module to strands wrapper in mlkit

Value Statement: As an MLOps Engineer who invokes Strands agents via StrandsBaseAgent, I need the ability to enable OpenTelemetry tracing using the Strands SDK's built-in telemetry module so that I can gain deeper observability into agent behavior, debug performance issues, and integrate with existing OTEL-compatible observability platforms.

AC: 
1. Telemetry Configuration in StrandsBaseAgent

When a user instantiates StrandsBaseAgent, the user has the ability to optionally enable OpenTelemetry tracing via a new telemetry_mode parameter.

Add new telemetry_mode parameter to StrandsBaseAgent.__init__():

Supported telemetry_mode values:
"disabled" (default): No OpenTelemetry tracing
"console": Enable ConsoleSpanExporter for local debugging without collector
"otlp": Enable OTLPSpanExporter when OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT is set
"both": Enable both console and OTLP exporters

2. Environment Variable Support

OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT - OTLP collector endpoint (optional)
OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_HEADERS - Headers for OTLP requests
OTEL_SERVICE_NAME - Service name (default: bip-ai-kit or mlkit)
OTEL_SEMCONV_STABILITY_OPT_IN - Semantic convention opt-in values
 Add new environment variable for build_wrapper_from_env():
STRANDS_TELEMETRY_MODE - Maps to telemetry_mode parameter
 Update build_wrapper_from_env() to include telemetry configuration:

3. Telemetry Initialization Method

When a user enables telemetry, the user has the ability to have it configured automatically with sensible defaults.

Method should:
Skip initialization if telemetry_mode == "disabled"
Set OTEL_SERVICE_NAME to f"mlkit-{self.project_name}" if not already set
Call StrandsTelemetry().setup_console_exporter() for console mode
Call StrandsTelemetry().setup_otlp_exporter() for otlp mode
Call both for "both" mode
 Telemetry initialization should be idempotent (safe to call multiple times)

4. Factory Methods for Common Configurations

When a user wants pre-configured telemetry setups, the user has the ability to use factory class methods.

 Add create_with_console_telemetry() class method:

Add create_with_otlp_telemetry() class method:

5. Integration with Existing Logging Hooks

When a user enables both MLKit logging and OTEL telemetry, the user has the ability to have both systems work together without conflicts.

 OTEL telemetry should complement (not replace) existing StrandsLoggingHooks
 Strands SDK's tracer automatically instruments agent spans when initialized
 No modifications needed to StrandsLoggingHooks - it continues to handle CloudWatch metrics/logs
 Document the relationship between logging modes and telemetry modes

6. Tracer Access Property

When a user needs direct access to the tracer, the user has the ability to get it via a property.

 Add tracer property to StrandsBaseAgent
Store telemetry_mode as instance attribute for reference

7. Metadata Extension

When a user calls get_mlkit_metadata(), the user has the ability to see telemetry configuration.

 Update get_mlkit_metadata() to include telemetry info

8. Metrics Integration (Optional Enhancement)

When a user wants OTEL metrics in addition to traces, the user has the ability to enable them.

 Add optional enable_metrics parameter (default: False):
Python
def _initialize_telemetry(self, telemetry_mode: str, enable_metrics: bool = False) -> None:
 When enabled, call StrandsTelemetry().setup_meter(enable_console_exporter=.. ., enable_otlp_exporter=... )
 Strands SDK's MetricsClient will automatically record:
strands. event_loop.cycle_count
strands.tool. call_count / success_count / error_count
strands.tool.duration
strands.event_loop.input. tokens / output.tokens
strands.model.time_to_first_token
9. Documentation

When a user reads the documentation, the user has the ability to understand how to enable and configure telemetry.

 Add docstrings to all new telemetry-related methods and parameters
 Update module docstring in strands_wrapper.py with telemetry section
 Create docs/strands_telemetry.md with:
Overview of telemetry capabilities (leverages Strands SDK)
Configuration options and environment variables
Example usage patterns for console vs OTLP modes
Relationship between logging_mode (CloudWatch) and telemetry_mode (OTEL)
How to view traces locally with console exporter

10. Testing

When a user runs tests, the user has the ability to verify telemetry functionality.

 Unit test for _initialize_telemetry() with each mode
 Unit test that telemetry initialization is idempotent
 Unit test for telemetry_mode parameter validation
 Unit test for build_wrapper_from_env() with STRANDS_TELEMETRY_MODE

summary: Plan IAM role migration to reduce legacy naming length issues
description: Story: As a BIP-AI Infra cloud engineer, I want to plan the migration of all resources using the current SageMaker domain execution role to the new shorter naming convention role that is already deployed so that we can deprecate the legacy naming convention that causes naming length issues for certain tenants. Assumptions: - The new shorter naming convention execution role is already deployed in each target AWS account/environment and is ready for use by all affected resources - The scope includes all environments where the legacy SageMaker domain execution role is in use (sbx, dev, stage, preprod, prod) unless explicitly excluded - The plan deliverable is a written document stored in a team-accessible location and linked from the ticket Acceptance Criteria: - Given the current environments when discovery is performed then the plan document lists all resource types and concrete resources currently referencing the legacy SageMaker domain execution role - Given an identified resource type when its configuration model is reviewed then the plan document states whether the execution role is mutable/immutable for that resource type and cites the specific mechanism/constraint that drives the conclusion - Given resources where the role reference is immutable when the migration approach is drafted then the plan document includes a safe path for each case (for example recreate/replace strategy) and the expected blast radius - Given the migration steps when tenant impact is assessed then the plan document specifies any expected downtime windows (or confirms no downtime), including best-case/likely/worst-case duration estimates - Given the migration steps when tenant responsibilities are assessed then the plan document lists required tenant actions after the change (if any), along with verification steps tenants can perform to confirm success - Given the overall migration approach when operational rollout is planned then the plan document includes a proposed schedule (phased by environment and/or tenant), prerequisites, and a rollback plan Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

summary: Integrate cosign verify Signature Validation Step into Image Builder Pipeline
description:
As a DevOps engineer or platform team member, I want the image builder pipeline to include a verification step using cosign verify after an image is pushed to ECR or Nexus, so that every container image released by our pipeline is proven to have a valid cryptographic signature from our trusted key, ensuring supply chain security.
The cosign verify command checks that an image in the registry is signed with the specific public key or KMS key we provide. It retrieves all registry-stored signatures associated with the image reference (SHA-based). It confirms that at least one signature matches our signing key. If the signature is present and valid, the signature details and metadata are displayed. If the signature is missing, invalid, or not from our key, verification fails and an explicit error is returned.

summary: Fix AWS Certificate Issue in Image Builder Pipeline
description:
As a platform/DevOps engineer I want to fix the AWS certificate (trust/CA) issue affecting the delegate in the image builder pipeline So that the delegate can successfully authenticate and push built images to Amazon ECR.
In the Harness pipeline run step that performs AWS/ECR actions, the pipeline exports: export AWS_CA_BUNDLE=/etc/ssl/certs/Amazon_Root_CA_1.pem The export occurs before any AWS CLI / ECR login / image push commands execute.
With the export in place, the pipeline can successfully: authenticate to ECR, and push the built image to the target ECR repository No TLS/certificate validation errors occur during auth or push.

summary: Develop unified crossplane manager resource retrieval for single pane of glass
description: Story: As a BIP-AI platform engineer, I want the crossplane manager to retrieve resources from multiple environment clusters into a unified cache organized by environment so that I can manage all crossplane resources through a single pane of glass interface. Assumptions: - The management pod has network access to the crossplane manager APIs in each target environment - Each environment's crossplane manager API is already deployed and accessible via a stable route - SBXMGMT and SBX environments are available for initial testing Acceptance Criteria: - Given multiple environment clusters when determining access requirements then a documented method exists for accessing the retrieve, pause, and unpause routes in each environment - Given the crossplane manager API when manager mode is implemented then it can operate in a unified manner retrieving resources from multiple configured environments - Given environment-specific API base URLs when configured via environment variables then the crossplane manager can retrieve resources from each specified environment - Given a user accessing the gateway from a management cluster when they request resources for a specified environment then the system returns that environment's crossplane resources - Given the SBXMGMT and SBX environments when end-to-end testing is performed then resources can be successfully retrieved from SBX via the SBXMGMT management cluster Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

summary: DEV Custom Logger Lambda for multi-tenant telemetry in IaC

summary: Investigate API gateway response streaming
description:
Title: Investigate API gateway response streaming

Value Statement: As an MLE on the BIP AI team, I want to investigate API gateway response streaming so I can recommend its use to specific use cases for tenants.

AC: 
-Document which API Gateway types support response streaming (REST API, HTTP API, WebSocket API)
-Identify supported integration types for streaming (Lambda, HTTP proxy, etc.)
-Document payload size limits, timeout constraints, and throughput limitations for streaming responses
-Research how Lambda response streaming works with API Gateway
-Document the Lambda runtime requirements and configuration needed (e.g., response streaming handler, InvokeWithResponseStream)
-Identify any cold start or latency implications when using streaming
-Document use cases where response streaming provides significant value (e.g., LLM token streaming, large file downloads, real-time data feeds)
-Document use cases where response streaming is not recommended or adds unnecessary complexity
-Provide a decision matrix or flowchart to help tenants determine if streaming is appropriate for their architecture
-Document the end-to-end implementation pattern for enabling response streaming
-Research error handling and retry strategies for streamed responses
-Document client-side requirements for consuming streamed responses (e.g., browser support, SDK requirements)
-Identify best practices for logging, monitoring, and debugging streaming endpoints

summary: Integrate SageMaker Processing Jobs Pipeline into Tenant-Agnostic Pipeline
description:
As a platform/data engineer I want to integrate the SageMaker Processing Jobs pipeline into the tenant-agnostic pipeline by adding a trigger in the SageMaker pipeline and a caller script in the tenant-agnostic pipeline that runs it and reports status back So that SageMaker processing can be executed and monitored consistently as part of the standard tenant-agnostic deployment/run workflow when enabled.
The SageMaker Processing Jobs pipeline exposes a triggerable entry point The trigger supports passing required inputs Tenant-agnostic pipeline includes a script/step that invokes (triggers) the SageMaker Processing Jobs pipeline. The caller script polls or subscribes for run status and reports progress/final outcome back to the tenant-agnostic pipeline. Success is reported only when the SageMaker run completes successfully. Failure is reported with the SageMaker failure reason/message surfaced in logs/output.

description: Identify repositories requiring migration to GitHub Enterprise Cloud for comprehensive migration planning **Value Statement** As a BIP AI DevOps engineer who manages platform infrastructure and code repositories, I need the ability to identify and catalog all repositories that need to migrate to GitHub Enterprise Cloud so that I can develop accurate migration timelines, assess risks, and ensure no critical repositories are overlooked during the platform transition. **Acceptance Criteria** When a user completes the repository identification process, the user has the ability to access a comprehensive inventory of all repositories with migration assessments and prioritization recommendations. * **Functionality that will validate that this story is complete** * Complete inventory of all current BIP AI repositories across existing platforms (GitHub.com, internal Git servers, other SCM tools) * Repository categorization by type (infrastructure, tenant code, documentation, archived projects) * Migration complexity assessment for each repository (dependencies, integrations, CI/CD pipelines) * Repository ownership and stakeholder identification for each codebase * Security classification and access requirements documentation * Migration priority ranking based on business criticality and technical dependencies * Integration dependencies mapping (CI/CD pipelines, webhooks, third-party tools) * **Documentation is updated** in Confluence with: * Repository migration inventory spreadsheet with all identified repositories * Migration complexity and risk assessment matrix * Repository ownership and contact information **Assumptions** * Access to all current repository platforms and administrative permissions will be provided * Repository owners and stakeholders will be available for consultation during the assessment * Current CI/CD and integration configurations can be reviewed and documented **Dependencies** This Story is dependent on the completion of: GitHub Enterprise Cloud provisioning and access setup **Notes** Per our conversations with the platform team, the following information may be useful: * BIP AI currently uses multiple repository platforms and needs consolidation * Some repositories may contain legacy code or archived projects that may not require migration * Critical production repositories should be prioritized for early migration phases * Consider tenant repositories vs infrastructure repositories for different migration approaches * Some repositories may have complex CI/CD integrations that require careful planning * Security and compliance requirements may affect migration sequencing **Out of Scope** * Actual repository migration execution (separate implementation stories) * New repository structure design or reorganization * CI/CD pipeline redesign or optimization * Repository cleanup or archival decisions (assessment only) * GitHub Enterprise Cloud configuration or setup * Team training or change management activities
